description: From Middle English disallowen, desallowen, a borrowing from Anglo-Norman desalouer, Old French desalöer; synchronically analyzable as dis- +‎ allow.

verbs.description: disallow (third-person singular simple present disallows, present participle disallowing, simple past and past participle disallowed)

examples: The prisoners were disallowed to contact with a lawyer.

entries.meaning: To reject as invalid, untrue, or improper
examples: The goal was disallowed because the player was offside.

entries.meaning: (UK, law, historical) to overrule a colonial legislation by the sovereign-in-privy council
